intro: Sutera integrifolia, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like hibiscus and cotton. Sutera integrifolia is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
